required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Beetroot Juice Doses and Anaerobic Performance
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Various Doses of Beetroot Juice on Anaerobic Performance

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine the effect of varying nitrate doses of beetroot juice supplementation on dynamic, multijoint resistance exercise performance in active, trained individuals. Performance will be assessed based on parameters including neuromuscular efficiency, anaerobic performance capability, oxygen consumption, plasma nitrate/nitrite levels, specific muscle tissue biomarkers including lactate, and anthropometric measurements of select muscle groups.

primary_outcome.description: Muscle activation/fiber recruitment to be measured in millivolts (mV) using electromyography (EMG) sensor during maximum voluntary contractions (MVC) and compared between study arms.

secondary_outcome.description: Plasma nitrate and nitrite levels will be measured at baseline and after 7 days of supplementation and compared between study arms.
Total number of repetitions in each session and number of repetitions performed at each respective % of 1 repetition maximum during each session will be recorded and compared between study arms.
Total oxygen consumption during testing sessions will be recorded and compared between study arms.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive approximately 8 mmol of dietary nitrate per day delivered as a commercially available beetroot juice supplement for 7 days.
Subjects will receive approximately 0.5 mmol of dietary nitrate per day delivered as a commercially available beetroot juice supplement for 7 days.
Subjects will receive a placebo beverage containing negligible nitrate for 7 days.

intervention.description: Commercially available concentrated beetroot juice supplement intended for athletes.
Fruit juice cordial containing negligible nitrate

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Minimum 6 consecutive months experience in resistance training, engaging at least 2 times per week.
- Possess sufficient mobility to properly execute movements required in testing protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Usage of any banned dietary supplements or performance enhancing drugs (thermogenics, anabolic steroids, prohormones, etc.)
- Any physical condition or malady that would impede participant from performing exercise or by doing so, endanger the individual

facility.name: Richardson Centre for Functional Foods and Nutraceuticals
